title: Homeland Security Demands Social Media Sites Reveal Names Behind Anti-ICE Posts
summary: The department has sent Google, Meta and other companies hundreds of subpoenas for information on accounts that track or comment on Immigration and Customs Enforcement, officials and tech workers said.

title: F.T.C. Chair Warns Apple Against Bias in Apple News
summary: Andrew Ferguson of the F.T.C. said in a letter to Apple that it might be violating consumer protection law by stifling conservative speech in its news aggregation service.

title: ‘Something Big Is Happening’ + A.I. Rocks the Romance Novel Industry + One Good Thing
summary: “I do think we are reaching an inflection point in people’s feelings and senses about A.I. and where it’s going.”

title: Iran Turns to Digital Surveillance Tools to Track Down Protesters
summary: As Iranian authorities restore some online services after crushing antigovernment demonstrations, they are using a technological dragnet to target attendees of the protests.

title: Why Tech Giants Are Accused of Causing Social Media Addiction
summary: In a series of landmark trials, plaintiffs are alleging that Meta, TikTok, Snap and YouTube caused personal injury through addictive products. Our technology reporter Cecilia Kang describes what’s at stake for tech giants and social media users.

title: Anthropic Is Valued at $380 Billion in New Funding Round
summary: The artificial intelligence start-up raised another $30 billion, and its valuation more than doubled since its last funding round in September.

title: Gail Slater Leaves Role as Justice Dept.’s Antitrust Chief
summary: Her departure follows months of mounting tension over her division’s work to determine whether companies violated antitrust laws.

title: Laid-Off Battery Plant Workers Pin Blame on Ford, not Trump, for Lost Jobs
summary: Ford Motor shut down a battery factory and laid off 1,600 workers after President Trump and Republicans gutted government support for electric vehicles.

title: Anthropic Donates $20 Million to Super PAC Operation to Counter OpenAI
summary: Anthropic and OpenAI now have their own well-funded political groups that will square off in the midterm elections over artificial intelligence safety and regulation.

title: Ford Will Make a Play for a Different Battery Market
summary: The company, long focused on cars and trucks, plans to begin manufacturing large batteries used by utilities, data centers, other businesses and homeowners.

title: Instagram Chief Says Social Media Is Not ‘Clinically Addictive’ in Landmark Trial
summary: Adam Mosseri, who leads the Meta-owned app, testified that the company was careful to test features used by young people before releasing them.

title: OpenAI’s Biggest Challenge Is Turning Its A.I. Into a Cash Machine
summary: The maker of ChatGPT hopes to triple its revenue in the coming year because it is planning to spend tens of billions of dollars. The clock is ticking.

title: Ford Says Electric Vehicle Losses Will Continue for 3 More Years
summary: Ford Motor reported a big loss for 2025 because of its troubled electric vehicle division, which it has significantly scaled back.

title: Elon Musk Wants to Build an A.I. Satellite Factory on the Moon
summary: In a meeting with employees at his company xAI, Mr. Musk revealed a vision for a facility that includes a giant catapult to launch his satellites into space.

title: YouTube Argues It Isn’t Social Media in Landmark Tech Addiction Trial
summary: The app said in opening statements that it was more of an entertainment platform. The lawsuit claims social media companies design products that cause personal injury.

title: A.I. Personalizes the Internet but Takes Away Control
summary: The relentless addition of artificial intelligence in popular apps raises questions about what’s at stake. The answer: the future of the internet and its lifeblood, digital advertising.

title: Meta and YouTube Created ‘Digital Casinos,’ Lawyers Argue in Landmark Trial
summary: Opening statements began in a trial claiming social media companies design addictive products that cause personal injury.

title: A.I. Is Making Doctors Answer a Question: What Are They Really Good For?
summary: Many physicians find chatbots threatening, but that doesn’t mean they’re giving up on medicine.
